Casa Calvet is more of an experience than really delicious food.  The building was designed by Antoni Gaudi, which of course makes it a unique place to be eating.  It is also fine dining, with fun touches like amuse bouches and a little cream dessert with coffee.  The food itself was not all great.  The Chickpea blood sausage appetzier was phenomenal.  The scallops were awful.  So maybe it just depends.  You may end up with a great meal.  Either way, I think you'll have a fun experience!  Be sure to make a reservation.
